intro: Platycaulos mlanjiensis, commonly known as the Malanje flatstem, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive flat, sprawling stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and under-studied species.
